stem: Given question: A car was going from Florida to Ohio, what was it doing? and answer: heading north, explain why in
no_more_50_words: Florida is to the south of Ohio, and you need to drive north to go from Florida to Ohio.
50_to_100_words: A car traveling from Florida to Ohio would be heading north because Ohio is located in the northern region of the United States, while Florida is located in the southern region. To travel from Florida to Ohio by car, one would need to drive in a northern direction in order to reach their destination. More specifically, if the trip is only by land, The trip would go through many states like Georgia, South Carolina, North Carolina, Virginia, West Virginia and so on, all of which are located to the north of Florida.
